Monitor to ensure configurations do not change from acceptable options

Ensure cross-layer checks at the NRF, between the certificate presented to it at the TLS connection setup stage and the identity and authorization requested presented to it at the OAuth Token request stage.
Ensure the consumer is authorized to ask about this service.

Authorization follows need-to-know rules, such as:
1. a NF can not query for NFs in other network slices
2. a NF can only query for NFs that it needs to communicate with.
NEF should check that UE in question is subscribed to services of the AF

Employ a firewall or other rate control box on the N2 interface [from RAN to AMF]

(May not be available in the market). NAS-MM (Non-access stratum Mobility Mgmt) app layer proxy with UE request rate limiting capability.
In addition, SCP can act as load balancer between the service consumer (AMF) and service producer (UDM). [Annex E of 23.501]

column2: Alteration of subscriber  profile charging parameters

column3: NRF not respond to requests after a given number of failed NSSAI lookups (See detections)
column4: NRF protection against brute-force attacks.
Restrictive user security profile. Do not use unencrypted systems. Set user security profile to prohibit bidding down to less secure service.
Disable location on UE device. This is only a partial mitigation because location parameters can still be available from UE.

Rate limiting at NFs. SEAF or AUSF (NFs upstream from SIDF) can do rate limiting if they receive the same SUCI multiple times within a short period.

Ensure gNB implementation and SMF implementations are both checking the CP & UP security policy against the most trustworthy source and taking action to not enable NULL encryption except for emergency calls
Network element security safeguards for gNBs, AMFs and SMFs.
Use multi-factor authentication on remote service logons where possible.
Limit the accounts that may use remote services. Limit the permissions for accounts that are at higher risk of compromise; for example, configure SSH so users can only run specific programs.

Move user equipment closer to base station. Increase height of User Equipment.
Detect and locate jammer with special equipment. Disable malicious transmitter.

Ensure UPF and gNB/NG-eNB check for uniqueness for every new TEID they allocate locally. The newly assigned TEID must not have been in use in the past given certain amount of time (which should be set to the reasonable maximum tunnel lifetimes observed).
The UPF and g/eNB must keep a log of the TEIDs currently in use (which they assigned), and purge TEIDs once the tunnel is torn down. This log must be checked every time a new TEID is allocated.

Sites should be provided with a full set of physical and environmental controls aimed to assure access control, monitoring, continuity of operations and protection against vandalism.
Ensure AMF implementation allocates new 5G-GUTI every time possible.

Edge sites should be provided with a full set of physical and environmental controls aimed to assure access control, monitoring, continuity of operations and protection against environmental disasters. Failure to do so may lead to unauthorized access, destruction of assets and impairment of operations.
Raceway / conduit is one of the easiest ways to protect any cable, fiber optic included. These hollow pieces of plastic act like a protective outer shell.

Optical fiber junction boxes / splice closures shall be accessible to maintenance personnel and maintenance vehicles. A closure should be located away from high traffic or conditions that could cause damage to the closure or injury to personnel.
Sites should be provided with a full set of physical and environmental controls aimed to assure access control, monitoring, continuity of operations and protection against environmental disasters

column3: Plan for continuity of power supplies
column4: Power supply facilities in the isolated area such as mobile base stations should preferably provide an uninterruptible power supply with capacity for all loading and capable of withstanding primary power supply failures for the duration of likely outages. If that is impossible, a mechanism to provide uninterruptible power to critical equipment should be installed. Batteries may need to be augmented with a private electric generator, especially in isolated areas.

The attack can be mitigated if the NRF performs additional checks. The NRF authorizes the NF service consumer to obtain tokens only for authorized slice(s). (3GPP SA3 investigating). A cross check with the TLS certificate of requester should be performed as well at the NRF.

Minimize exposure of functions to only those partner functions that need to access.  For so
Management of credentials used by partners to be scoped to the least privilege can minimize potential abuse.  Does not mitigate misuse within allowed privileges.
Ensure communication with functions such as a SEPP is constrained to necessary addresses, ports, and protocols.
Validation of credentials properly can mitigate some MITM attacks and ensure revoked/expired credentials are not allowed.
